title: As Wildfires Grow Fiercer, Some Companies Look to Rebuild the Tree Supply C

title: Phantom Forests: Why Ambitious Tree Planting Projects Are Failing
excerpt: High-profile initiatives to plant millions of trees are being touted by governments around the world as major contributions to fighting climate change. But scientists say many of these projects are ill-conceived and poorly managed and often fail to grow any forests at all.

title: At Old Coal Mines, the American Chestnut Tries for a Comeback
excerpt: Across Appalachia, scientists and foresters are trying to reintroduce a hybrid version, helping to revive damaged land while also bringing back a beloved tree.

title: Why an American chestnut tree in Centreville is the 'holy grail' for conservationists
excerpt: The American chestnut tree used to grow throughout the eastern U.S., but was devastated by a blight in the early 20th century.

title: Into the Forbidden Forest
excerpt: Famed American biologist Patricia Wright explores an astonishing breadth of biodiversity in the wilderness of Madagascar
